Posts.Title: To Tell Or Not To Tell KellyC KellyC

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 08:22AM farila_1966 wrote: Hi Kelly, You have such a cute bunch of kids there.. Give them a big hug from me. It is a tough decision to make. I had 4 1/2 yrs old son and 11 month daughter with special needs when dx. My sister was in last stage of BC. I knew she would not be there around much longer and my son would witness her die of cancer. So I decided to explain him that cancer does not mean death always.. but was not sure what words to use. So took help of a counselor and then talked to him. Like you said it was easier back then. Now I don't know how would I break news to them.. they are 13 and 17 yrs now. I agree with Blue above that may be what your son thinks and assumes could be much worse than the reality. It would be good if you let them know. There is no way we can hide cancer from people close to us forever.. something leaks out. Some words, actions, tears .. they all drop hints that something is wrong. Kids are more quick in grasping things then we ever imagine. Struggling at the school could be an indicator that something is troubling him.. may be his instincts tell him something is wrong with Mommy. I am a Mom like you and I am too in a dillemma as to what is good for the kids.. it is so tough making decisions. In my opinion it would be better to explain to them lightly about the recurrance and let them know Mom is going through another sickness and she will fight very hard to win second time around.. for them. Because she loves them and wants to be with them.. Love and hugs Farila
Posts.Title: To Tell Or Not To Tell KellyC KellyC

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 11:56PM - edited Jun 7, 2009 12:50AM by farila_1966 #??????- Hey ladies.. people are same everywhere in the world and this thread proved it to me. I always thought the people around ME were narrow minded to talk shit. # . From DH. "You look like a one horned cow we once had in our home". A week after my surgery when I was looking at myself. (It ended with his tears and went very near to divorce. I haven't forgiven him for that yet) # ???? Can I see how the operated spot looks like? From my aunt, neighbour, so called friend etc. They all got the 'you dare' look... #???? Anyway you were always brains and no beauty. I don't think this will affect you much. Yeah- my sister who is beauty minus brains and heart. ;).. From my younger sister who has not known cancer or its pain. I had a wonderful sister who I lost to cancer.. 13 years ago. I am not going to watch that song... I hate it already. www.chaptersfrommylife.blogspot.com
